verses.verse: And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> visited <S%H6485><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%> as he had said <S%H559><s%>, and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to Sarah <S%H8283><s%> as he had spoken <S%H1696><s%>.

For Sarah <S%H8283><s%> conceived <S%H2029><s%>, and gave birth to <S%H3205><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%> in his old age <S%H2208><s%>, at the set time <S%H4150><s%> of which God <S%H430><s%> had spoken to him <S%H1696><s%>.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of his son <S%H1121><s%> that was born <S%H3205><s%> to him <S%H8283><s%>, whom Sarah gave birth <S%H3205><s%> to him <S%H3327><s%>, Isaac.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> circumcised <S%H4135><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> being eight <S%H8083><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> old <S%H1121><s%>, as God <S%H430><s%> had commanded him <S%H6680><s%>.
And Abraham <S%H85><s%> was an hundred <S%H3967><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%>, when his son <S%H1121><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was born to him <S%H3205><s%>.
And Sarah <S%H8283><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, God <S%H430><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> me to laugh <S%H6712><s%>, so that all that hear <S%H8085><s%> will laugh with me <S%H6711><s%>.

And she said <S%H559><s%>, Who would have said <S%H4448><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, that Sarah <S%H8283><s%> should have given sons <S%H1121><s%> suck <S%H3243><s%>? for I have born <S%H3205><s%> him a son <S%H1121><s%> in his old age <S%H2208><s%>.

And the child <S%H3206><s%> grew <S%H1431><s%>, and was weaned <S%H1580><s%>: and Abraham <S%H85><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> feast <S%H4960><s%> the same day <S%H3117><s%> that Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was weaned <S%H1580><s%>.
And Sarah <S%H8283><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hagar <S%H1904><s%> the Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>, which she had born <S%H3205><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, mocking <S%H6711><s%>.

Therefore she said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, Cast out <S%H1644><s%> this bondwoman <S%H519><s%> and her son <S%H1121><s%>: for the son <S%H1121><s%> of this bondwoman <S%H519><s%> shall not be heir <S%H3423><s%> with my son <S%H1121><s%>, even with Isaac <S%H3327><s%>.
And the thing <S%H1697><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> severe <S%H3415><s%> in Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s sight <S%H5869><s%> because <S%H182><s%> of his son <S%H1121><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, Let it not be severe <S%H3415><s%> in your sight <S%H5869><s%> because of the lad <S%H5288><s%>, and because of your bondwoman <S%H519><s%>; in all that Sarah <S%H8283><s%> has said <S%H559><s%> to you <S%H8085><s%>, listen to her voice <S%H6963><s%>; for in Isaac <S%H3327><s%> shall your seed <S%H2233><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%>.
And also of the son <S%H1121><s%> of the bondwoman <S%H519><s%> will I make <S%H7760><s%> a nation <S%H1471><s%>, because he is your seed <S%H2233><s%>.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>, and a bottle <S%H2573><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> it to Hagar <S%H1904><s%>, putting <S%H7760><s%> it on her shoulder <S%H7926><s%>, and the child <S%H3206><s%>, and sent her away <S%H7971><s%>: and she departed <S%H3212><s%>, and wandered <S%H8582><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Beer <S%H884><s%>–sheba.
And the water <S%H4325><s%> was spent <S%H3615><s%> in <S%H4480><s%> the bottle <S%H2573><s%>, and she cast <S%H7993><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> under one <S%H259><s%> of the shrubs <S%H7880><s%>.

And she went <S%H3212><s%>, and sat her down <S%H3427><s%> over against <S%H5048><s%> him a good way off <S%H7368><s%>, as it were a bowshot <S%H2909><s%>: for she said <S%H559><s%>, Let me not see <S%H7200><s%> the death <S%H4194><s%> of the child <S%H3206><s%>. And she sat <S%H3427><s%> over against him <S%H5375><s%>, and lift up her voice <S%H6963><s%>, and wept <S%H1058><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the lad <S%H5288><s%>; and the angel <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> to Hagar <S%H1904><s%> out of heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> to her <S%H1904><s%>, What ails you, Hagar? fear <S%H3372><s%> not <S%H430><s%>; for God has heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the lad where he is <S%H5288><s%>.
Arise <S%H6965><s%>, lift up <S%H5375><s%> the lad <S%H5288><s%>, and hold <S%H2388><s%> him in yours hand <S%H3027><s%>; for I will make <S%H7760><s%> him a great <S%H1419><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> opened <S%H6491><s%> her eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and she saw <S%H7200><s%> a well <S%H875><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>; and she went <S%H3212><s%>, and filled <S%H4390><s%> the bottle <S%H2573><s%> with water <S%H4325><s%>, and gave <S%H8248><s%> the lad <S%H5288><s%> drink <S%H8248><s%>.
And God <S%H430><s%> was with the lad <S%H5288><s%>; and he grew <S%H1431><s%>, and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, and became an archer <S%H7235><s%>.

And he lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Paran <S%H6290><s%>: and his mother <S%H517><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> him a wife <S%H802><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

And it came to pass at that time <S%H6256><s%>, that Abimelech <S%H40><s%> and Phichol <S%H6369><s%> the chief captain <S%H8269><s%> of his army <S%H6635><s%> spoke <S%H559><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, God <S%H430><s%> is with you in all that you do <S%H6213><s%>:

Now therefore swear <S%H7650><s%> to me here <S%H2008><s%> by God <S%H430><s%> that you will not deal falsely <S%H8266><s%> with me <S%H5209><s%>, nor with my son, nor with my son <S%H5220><s%>'s son: but according to the kindness <S%H2617><s%> that I have done <S%H6213><s%> to you <S%H6213><s%>, you shall do to me <S%H776><s%>, and to the land where you have stayed <S%H1481><s%>.
And Abraham <S%H85><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, I will swear <S%H7650><s%>.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> complained to <S%H3198><s%> Abimelech <S%H40><s%> because <S%H182><s%> of a well <S%H875><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>, which Abimelech <S%H40><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> had violently taken away <S%H1497><s%>.

And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, I know <S%H3045><s%> not who has done <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>: neither <S%H3808><s%> did you tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H3808><s%>, neither yet heard <S%H8085><s%> I of it <S%H1115><s%>, but today <S%H3117><s%>.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> and oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> them to Abimelech <S%H40><s%>; and both of them <S%H8147><s%> made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%>.
And Abraham <S%H85><s%> set <S%H5324><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> of the flock by themselves <S%H6629><s%>.
And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, What <S%H2008><s%> mean these seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> which you have set by themselves <S%H5324><s%>?

And he said <S%H559><s%>, For these seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> shall you take <S%H3947><s%> of my hand <S%H3027><s%>, that <S%H5668><s%> they may be a witness <S%H5713><s%> to me <S%H2658><s%>, that I have dug this well <S%H875><s%>.
Therefore he called <S%H7121><s%> that place <S%H4725><s%> Beer <S%H884><s%>–sheba; because there they swore <S%H7650><s%> both of them <S%H8147><s%>.

Thus they made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> at Beer <S%H884><s%>–sheba: then Abimelech <S%H40><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and Phichol <S%H6369><s%> the chief captain <S%H8269><s%> of his army <S%H6635><s%>, and they returned <S%H7725><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>.

And Abraham planted <S%H5193><s%> a grove <S%H815><s%> in Beer <S%H884><s%>–sheba, and called <S%H7121><s%> there on the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, the everlasting <S%H5769><s%> God <S%H410><s%>.
And Abraham <S%H85><s%> stayed <S%H1481><s%> in the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>' land <S%H776><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>.
